main event: Multiple reports of unidentified flying objects over Chile in March 1950.
interesting points: First sighting was at Punta Arenas on March 11, with many inhabitants witnessing the phenomenon, which was described as an object that appeared erratic or 'disappearing' and shaped like a ping-pong ball at high altitude.
Second sighting of a disc took place in the Santiago area, San Bernardo and Valparaiso on the 24th and 25th of March, with the usual description given by the populace.
Third sighting of a disc occurred on March 28 between 1330 and 1410 over Santiago, with Chileans in the area reporting people looking into the sky observing this phenomenon.
An observer, M/Sgt. -, assigned to a nearby air base, was tasked with assessing the speed and altitude of the object.
On March 29, the local authorities determined that the object witnessed the previous day was actually the planet Venus.
result: The sightings were determined to be the planet Venus.
sighted object: Unidentified flying objects, described as silver-colored discs or ping-pong ball shaped objects.
location: Chile, including Punta Arenas, Santiago, San Bernardo, and Valparaiso.
witnesses: Civilians, including many inhabitants of the cities where the sightings occurred, as well as an observer, M/Sgt. -, assigned to a nearby air base.
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
